timeline.message:
[JENKINS-46175] Add API to SimpleBuildStep

Two new methods are added:
- requiresWorkspace(), defaulted to returning true
- an overload of perform() that only takes a Run, EnvVars and listener
  - the "full-fat" perform() delegates to this one when requiresWorkspace() returns false

This enables steps to declare they do not need a workspace context.
BuildStepCompatibilityLayer honors this and won't try to get a workspace when one is not required.

[JENKINS-46175] Add API to SimpleBuildWrapper

These changes mirror those in SimpleBuildStep.

Disposer has the same changes applied except that the choice of requiring a workspace is made as part of the constructor, based on a wrapper instance.
Alternatively, it could choose this on its own, the way the step and wrapper do.

timeline.bodyText: Invert the sense of the field since a deserialized Disposer from a Jenkins session prior to upgrade (for Pipeline builds) will have fields set to default values like false unless you implement readResolve.

replies.bodyText:
Do these actually get persisted? I thought they were only serialized for sending to the agent for execution.
But sure, inverting the field's meaning is easy.
Or, I could just make this a method like on the other objects, avoiding the serialization issue entirely.

      */

+

+         * Creates a new end-of-wrapped-block callback.

replies.bodyText:
That is possible for non-pipeline cases only. When we're dealing with AbstractBuild, then the final overrides of setUp() and preCheckout() offer a place where I can tell the Context whether or not the wrapper needs a workspace context. Then I can just use a private Boolean field on both Context and Disposer to pass the flag across.
But for pipeline use, all methods involved are virtual and non-final, so there does not seem to be any place in code where I can guarantee interaction between the created Context and the SimpleBuildWrapper instance. The equivalent place in CoreWrapperStep would be the doStart() method. But then I would have to add public API to Context to flag the requirement there, which feels worse than simply allowing the Dispatcher to be told at construction time.
replies.author: Zastai

replies.bodyText:
add public API to Context to flag the requirement there

What is the problem with that? Plugin authors would never notice such an API; would be used only from workflow-basic-steps plus core itself.
replies.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: Are there really no use cases supported other than AbstractBuild or pipeline? If not, then I suppose it's fine as long as workflow-basic-steps sets things up correctly.
replies.author: Zastai

replies.bodyText:
Are there really no use cases supported other than AbstractBuild or pipeline?

No, that is it.
replies.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: OK, I think I have something that works. Note that I think this does mean that when an old version of workflow-basic-steps is used with new core + a plugin with a wrapper marked as no-workspace-required, then any Disposer for that wrapper will require that context and potentially fail (because the Context.setWorkspaceRequirement() won't have been called).
replies.author: Zastai

timeline.message:
Adjust Disposer setup

This now uses a field with inverted meaning (for compatibility with
old serialized instances).
It also adds a constructor taking a boolean as well as a
requiresWorkspace() predicate method (for use by callers to determine
which of the tearDown() methods to call).
Extended JavaDoc for the tearDown methods.

Adjust exception use

Use IllegalStateException() instead of AbortException().
Tweaked and aligned JavaDoc.
Adjusted method order.

More Disposer changes

Its workspace requirement now tracks that of the wrapper via Context.
Finish a sentence in a comment.

This is on Context, so an implementation of SimpleBuildWrapper generally does not need to care anyway.

timeline.message:
Correct method accessibility.

While `SimpleBuildStep` is an interface, `SimpleBuildWrapper` is a
class, so needs an explicit `public`.

Enable optional-but-handled workspace context

This adjusts the call sites to always call the with-workspace-context
methods when such a context is available, regardless of whether it is
required.

Mark internal API

This adds `@Restricted(Beta.class)` as suggested, to indicate methods
that are part of an internal-only API (essentially they should be
called by the workflow-basic-steps plugin only).
(Does feel like there should be a better tag than "BETA" to indicate
this.)

+ * When such a context is required (the default), {@link #setUp(Context, Run, FilePath, Launcher, TaskListener, EnvVars)} applies. + * Otherwise, {@link #setUp(Context, Run, TaskListener, EnvVars)} applies. + * + * @return {@code true} if this wrapper requires a workspace context; {@code false} otherwise. + * @since TODO + */ + public boolean requiresWorkspace() { + return true; + } + /** * Called when a segment of a build is started that is to be enhanced with this wrapper. + *

+ * This method must be overridden when this wrapper requires a workspace context. If such a context + * is not required, it does not need to be overridden; it will then forward to + * {@link #setUp(Context, Run, TaskListener, EnvVars)}. + * * @param context a way of collecting modifications to the environment for nested steps * @param build a build being run * @param workspace a workspace of the build * @param launcher a way to start commands * @param listener a way to report progress * @param initialEnvironment the environment variables set at the outset + * @throws AbstractMethodError if this wrapper requires a workspace context, and this method is not overridden + * @throws IOException if something fails; {@link AbortException} for user errors + * @throws InterruptedException if setup is interrupted + */ + public void setUp(Context context, Run build, FilePath workspace, Launcher launcher, TaskListener listener, EnvVars initialEnvironment) throws IOException, InterruptedException { + // If this does not require a workspace, defer to the version that does not take a workspace and launcher. + if (!this.requiresWorkspace()) { + this.setUp(context, build, listener, initialEnvironment); + return; + } + throw new AbstractMethodError("Unless a build wrapper is marked as not requiring a workspace context, you must implement the overload of the setUp() method that takes both a workspace and a launcher."); + } + + /** + * Called when a segment of a build is started that is to be enhanced with this wrapper. + *

+ * This method must be overridden when this wrapper does not require a workspace context, and + * must not be called when such a context is required.

timeline.message:
Tweak JavaDoc as suggested by @jglick

This also removes some unnecessary diffs (one `this.` qualifier), and
one automated import ordering.

Adjust wrapper context creation

As suggested by @jglick; a Context is now canonically created via
SimpleBuildWrapper.createContext(), which will tell the context
whether or not there is a workspace requirement (which is then
passed on to any Disposer as before).
